saguṇa：a．[sa-guṇa] 重畳ある．saguṇaṃ karoti たたむ，包む．

Saguṇa，（adj．） [either sa3+guṇa1 1，as given under guṇa1； or sa°=saṁ° once，as in sakṛt，+guṇa1 2] either “with the string，” or “in one”； Vin．I，46 （saguṇaṁ karoti to put together，to fold up； C ekato katvā）．This interpretation （as “put together”） is much to be preferred to the one given under guṇa1 1； saguṇaṁ katvā belongs to saṅghāṭiyo，and not to kāyabandhanaṁ，thus：“the upper robes are to be given，putting them into one （bundle）．” （Page 661）
